p: Molecular mimicry, as a result of the cross-reacting epitope between the virus and the host, leads to both humoral and cellular autoreactivity (Fig. 1a) [ 53]. This mechanism plays a vital role in the pathogenesis of prototype systemic rheumatological diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis (RA), systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), systemic sclerosis, and Sjogren syndrome [ 54]. SARS-CoV-2 proteins displayed at least one match with the human protein on a comparative peptidome analysis comprising of 37 viral proteins [ 55]. These similarities potentially can lead to loss of tolerance to self-peptides and result in autoimmunity. Recently, an epitope mapping analysis has identified immunogenic linear epitopes, 2′-O-ribose methyltransferase, RNA-dependent RNA polymerase and 3′-to-5′ exonuclease proteins from autoimmune dermatomyositis patients matching with the SARS-CoV-2 peptides [ 56].
